page.title: 10Marine Training Camp.
page.content: The Commando Training centre Royal Marines lies between Exton and Lympstone on a large area of land between the main road and the estuary. It is the country's main training centre for Marines,the fighting section of the Navy.Recruits are taken at 16-17 years old and the rigorous course lasts 10 weeks.The emphasis is on discipline and physical fitness and only the best suited survive;40% drop out by the end of 10 weeks.The camp was only a small collection of wooden huts in 1963 but now is a large,almost self contained communtiy with a church, medical unit,dentist and railway station.Qualified Marines move onto a commando unit elsewhere in Britain and and will specialise in a chosen skill (like cook or mechanic)so as to gain qualifications for later life.
